channel.title: Monica W. Gerber
channel.description: Recent content on Monica W. Gerber

item.title: A little bit of Monica in my life
item.description: One analysis in the R community that caught my attention is Hilary Parker’s analysis of the most poisoned baby name in US history. I was surprised that my own name didn’t show up in the analysis. If Hilary had a huge loss in 1993, what happened to Monica in 1999? For a period when I was a kid the name ‘Monica’ is what made the adults turn down the NPR broadcast.

item.title: Reflections on rstudio::conf 2018
item.description: I have a confession. The first time I used R, when I was a Freshman at Reed College and taking Math 141, I hated it. At the time, R was something that intimidated me and seemed to add more work to my schedule. Oh, how have things changed! Years later I started using R again What makes a successful conference experience? Coming away from the rstudio::conf 2018 with a feeling of excitement and motivation to get started on projects and to conribute to the R community is a good sign of success.

item.title: Hello, world!
item.description: About my work My name is Monica Gerber and I am a Biostatistician located in Boston, Massachusetts. I started working at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) in January 2015, when I joined the Department of Psychiatry to work in a research group focused on population mental health. Currently, I work in General Academic Pediatrics and the Center for Community Health Improvement (CCHI). At MGH I have the pleasure of working on many research and evaluation projects.
